title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to John A. McDonnell, April 24, 1867
summary: Jackson forwards a complaint regarding one party's failure to pay money owed. As the case crossed division lines, the complaint was forwarded to R.S. Lacey, the Sub Assistant Commissioner of the seventh Sub-District, and it was subsequently passed on to J.W. Sharp, the Agent in charge of Rockbridge County.
